Articles.Content: Have fun in your pesky enclosed carts. I'll be riding on the back. Holding on the back, I mean.
FIRST CLASS RULES!

Based on what Mu (now the lead dev) and NathanKell said in Thursday's Squadcast, 1.1.3 is more than mere patches and buffixes--they're finally taking the first steps (maybe more than just steps) towards rewriting all the KSP code, making it lean and clean.  This is the way to no more stutters, no more memory leaks, no more lagginess, and probably no more crashes.

In the area of garbage collection, they cited vessel unloading as a prime offender, producing excessive amount of garbage.  In 1.1.3, it now produces ZERO garbage.

*Kicks football into carriage and follows it*

What happened to the footballs mod anyway? Does it still work? Or was it abandoned.

4 minutes ago, cantab said:

*Kicks football into carriage and follows it*

What happened to the footballs mod anyway? Does it still work? Or was it abandoned.

It was abandoned at 0.23.5
I know, never got to download it.

42 minutes ago, Laguna said:

Based on what Mu (now the lead dev) and NathanKell said in Thursday's Squadcast, 1.1.3 is more than mere patches and buffixes--they're finally taking the first steps (maybe more than just steps) towards rewriting all the KSP code, making it lean and clean.

Woah, there was a squadcast again?  Sweet, I'll have to go watch that.
Eh, why not. Maybe I'll get to see a Class 86 in a museum trackside somewhere along the way.
If you look out the right side window, you'll see the train that HarvesteR and DanRosas are taking away from Squad. Say hello and goodbye, everyone!
So how confident are we to see the patch in the next few days ? the orbital decay is so bad on one of my stations i don't even dare make it active...
here's my ticket,First class please?

I'll save my hype and wait for the next train.  This train has bad wheels and is likely to derail.

Here is my reaction image

It's not even worth the bandwidth.

Edited June 10, 2016 by Alshain

3 hours ago, Laguna said:

rewriting all the KSP code

Really?! I made my first planet pack not too long ago, and now I have to COMPLETELY REWRITE IT?! No thanks, no hype train for me.

9 minutes ago, electricpants said:

Really?! I made my first planet pack not too long ago, and now I have to COMPLETELY REWRITE IT?! No thanks, no hype train for me.

Relax.  Code rewrites happen all the time, that doesn't mean the methods you use will change their definition.  Of all the reasons, not to download 1.1.3, that isn't one of them.

Edited June 10, 2016 by Alshain
Hypers gonna hype. Put me down for a sleeper car.

17 minutes ago, electricpants said:

Really?! I made my first planet pack not too long ago, and now I have to COMPLETELY REWRITE IT?! No thanks, no hype train for me.

Assuming your planet pack relies on Kopernicus like all other modern KSP planet mods do, then no. The Kopernicus folks will deal with any changes they need to make, and work to keep the format of the planet pack files virtually the same.

Alright, so, calm hype. Ok. I can do this. I can do this. Here goes. hypehypehypehypehype

 

There. Any questions or concerns regarding the calm hype.

I really hope that HooliganLabs Airships is updated again for 1.1.3. BTW, HooliganLabs Airships is back for 1.1.2, check it out here: 

 

Okay, I will be riding 2nd class again. And also, this isn't going anywhere near the speed of the 1.1 hype train. Because this is just a hype train for a patch that solves the problems that keeps people on 1.0.5.

Update #3: WAIT, WHA! The squadcasts are back!???!? Man, I've missed them so much. (Just Kidding.)

For some reason, my posts keep on adding on to one posts. SMH :V

53 minutes ago, electricpants said:

Really?! I made my first planet pack not too long ago, and now I have to COMPLETELY REWRITE IT?! No thanks, no hype train for me.

Yes, as was previously mentioned, it's not going to change in any radical way (aside from whatever changes 1.1.3 brings), just a long-overdue top-to-bottom cleaning is in the works.  Still is going to work the same way, just be far more efficient and faster--and no memory leaks, stutters, lagging or crashes, AND easier for less-than-high-end processors to handle.  Mike (Mu) even said that all the deprecated code that mod authors have complained about is slated for removal at last.  The first steps will be taken in 1.1.3, but NathanKell and Mu said that the full overhaul will be part of 1.2.

And to be honest, even if 1.1.3 (or 1.2) does break every mod out there, I'll be fine with it, as a code overhaul needs to be done, as the stutters and crashes aren't something that can be fixed with a simple patch.

Edited June 11, 2016 by Laguna
Not sure about 1.1.3, but I'm thinking 1.2.4 might be pretty cool.

Woo-oo-woo!

Any chance of a footplate ride-along? I don't mind shoveling coal if it helps.
I'm sorry, I <cough> left my ticket in my compartment, conductor!
Alright, here's my new ticket, let me on

Ive made some dangerous trains in the past, self propelled fuel tanks screaming along at 35ms on unstable terrain. the slightest wrong move from the driver means death for train and crew. its fair to say trains in my experience are more lethal than any other craft in KSP..

However.. in the history of the KTP, ive never built a train more dangerous than this..

Please Help 1.1.3..  we need you

Yay, bug fixes! Here is my ticket. I payed a lot of money to some guy who emailed me a trusted friend who sells tickets.

Spoiler

Ok ok, here's my real one
